intro: Dipteracanthus microcalyx, commonly known as the small-flowered dipteracanthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories.
